intro: Ranunculus curvirostratus, commonly known as the curved-beak buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with five petals that resemble a beak, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are often hairy. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many species of buttercups and related plants.
